channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US Election 2024: Polling date, time, coverage, and streaming options; know all about it
item.description: As the 2024 US presidential election approaches, Kamala Harris and Donald Trump ramp up campaigns in key battleground states. The election is set for November 5, 2024, with results potentially taking days if the race is close. Key swing states and the possibility of an electoral tie remain crucial factors in determining the outcome.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am married to a strong woman': Donald Trump says Mark Cuban is very insecure
item.description: ​​Trump said the list of strong and intelligent women around him is long and he mentioned that he happens to be married to a rather strong woman Melania, who just had a No.1 bestseller book in the whole world. "I have given women chances too. Kellyanne was the head of my 2016 victory. Susie Wiles is strong...I have tremendously strong women," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: MAGA meltdown over Indians stealing jobs as racial abuse mounts
item.description: Recent Bureau of Labor Statistics data highlighted that while native-born Americans lost 773,000 jobs over the past year, foreign-born workers gained 1 million jobs. MAGA media and pro-Trump economists allege this supports the 'great replacement theory,' blaming immigrants for job losses. The debate stirs online resentment towards Indian tech workers, despite some defending their contributions.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard speaks up on 'intelligent woman' row; roasts both Mark Cuban, Liz Cheney
item.description: In a statement, Tulsi Gabbard roasted both Mark Cuban and Kamala Harris supporter Liz Cheney as she said the premise of Mark Cuban's recent comment is that Liz Cheney -- since she is supporting Kamala Harris -- is a strong woman. "But the reality is they are hypocritical cowers because as @realDonaldTrump pointed out, they are eager to send our troops into war, but they would never volunteer to put their own lives on the line for such military adventures. That’s not strength. That’s hypocrisy and cowardice."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy tape: Donald Trump's son says all celebs like JLo, Beyonce have a price
item.description: "We know about Epstein, Harvey Weinstein, We know about Diddy's parties..." Benny Johnson said. "Three Democrats...All of them are Democrats," Eric added. "Mega donors," Johnson said. "Diddy tape must be tough," Johnson said naming Eminem, Usher. Jennifer Lopez endorsed Kamala Harris after comedian Tony Hinchcliffe called Puerto Rico an island of garbage -- at Trump's MSG event. As a Puerto Rican, JLo took offence and endorsed Kamala Harris to which MAGA supporters reminded her that she was the ex-girlfriend of Diddy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Archaeologists uncover 11 sealed burials in ancient Egyptian Tomb at Luxor
item.description: Archaeologists from Egypt and the US discovered 11 sealed burials from the Middle Kingdom near Luxor, including coffins of men, women, and children. Significant findings include an amethyst necklace and ancient mirrors. This aligns with Egypt's efforts to revive tourism, showcasing its historical treasures amid economic challenges. The Grand Egyptian Museum also unveiled new exhibition halls recently.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Democrat Rashida Tlaib refuses to endorse Kamala Harris: 'This election didn't have to be close'
item.description: "Trump is a proud Islamophobe + serial liar who doesn't stand for peace. The reality is that the Biden admin’s unconditional support for genocide is what got us here. This should be a wake-up call for those who continue to support genocide. This election didn't have to be close," Rashida Tlaib posted on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump doubles down on Liz Cheney amid 'war hawk' row, calls her 'disaster'
item.description: Donald Trump put out a clarification on Truth Social in which he wrote that he called Liz Cheney a war hawk and a dumb war hawk. But she wouldn't have "the guts" to fight herself. Pushing harder on that remark, Trump then said during his campaign stops that Liz Cheney is a disaster. If you ever put her on a battlefield, she will be the first one to chicken out, Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Swing states: Mark Halperin says Kamala Harris not doing well in Georgia, NC, Arizona
item.description: Citing one Democrat and two Republican sources, Halperin said that they would be "somewhere between surprised and shocked" if Harris wins Wisconsin. If she does not win Georgia, North Carolina and Arizona, she must sweep Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin to defeat Trump but she is in trouble in Wisconsin. Kamala Harris may win Pennsylvania but lose the White House as she may lose Wisconsin, Halperin said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: This New Jersey pro-Trump woman votes in bra after election workers urged her to...
item.description: A New Jersey woman voting early at a Hamilton Township firehouse removed her top to comply with election laws banning political gear. Wearing a MAGA hat and Trump t-shirt, she stripped down to her bra after being told the attire wasn't allowed, leading to a controversial scene reported and discussed extensively.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rescuers end search for survivors after 14 die in canopy collapse in northern Serbia
item.description: Serbian rescuers have ceased their search after recovering 14 bodies from a collapsed canopy at Novi Sad railway station, where the tragedy also left three people seriously injured. The government has called for a day of mourning and a thorough investigation, amidst criticism over possible corruption and shoddy renovations. Residents have held a vigil for the victims.

item.title: Battle for the Blue Wall states: Will Trump be able to crack them?
item.description: As the 2024 U.S. presidential election approaches, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Wisconsin, known as the 'Blue Wall' states, are key battlegrounds. Both candidates, Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump, are focusing heavily on these states. The outcome in these regions could significantly influence the election's result, making them critical to watch.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Your daddy's bullsh*t war': Joey Jones slams Liz Cheney over Trump remarks
item.description: Joey Jones criticizes Liz Cheney over her stance on Donald Trump, expressing frustration at veterans' sacrifices during her father's wars. Jones's comments garnered widespread support online. Meanwhile, Trump labeled Cheney a 'radical war hawk,' challenging her readiness to fight and condemning her father's actions in the Middle East for profit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Serbia mourns victims after roof collapse kills 14
item.description: Serbia mourns after a roof collapse at Novi Sad’s main train station killed 14 and left three seriously injured. Authorities have launched an investigation, with Interior Minister Ivica Dacic confirming that 20 people, including ministry and Serbia Railways officials, are being questioned. President Aleksandar Vucic has promised accountability for the tragedy.

item.title: Iran's supreme leader threatens Israel, US with 'crushing response' amid rising regional tensions
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has threatened a 'crushing response' against Israel and the United States if attacks on Iran and its allies persist. This statement follows an October 26 attack by Israeli forces on Iranian military bases and a preceding Iranian missile strike in retaliation for Israeli actions against Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No male friends, hair and makeup by experts everyday': Dubai influencer reveals millionaire husband's rules
item.description: Soudi Al Nadak's viral Instagram video showcases the strict lifestyle rules set by her millionaire husband in Dubai, which include coordinating outfits and avoiding work or male friendships. Garnering over 3 million views, the video has received mixed reactions, reflecting admiration for luxury and criticism for personal restrictions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Greek police arrest man over Athens apartment blast
item.description: Greek police have arrested a 31-year-old man linked to a home-made bomb explosion in Athens that killed one and injured another. The explosion, suspected to occur during bomb-making, is associated with anti-establishment guerrilla groups. The suspect denied involvement despite sharing keys to the involved apartment. Recent years have seen a decline in such attacks.

item.title: 'Dark day': Megyn Kelly predicts chaos under Harris' potential presidency
item.description: Megyn Kelly warns of a 'dark day' if Kamala Harris becomes president, criticizing her stance on immigration, transgender rights, and economic policies. Kelly claims Harris’s progressive agenda could worsen border issues, impact taxpayer funds, and raise taxes. Kelly also contends Democrats might legally block a potential Trump return and alleges media bias in ignoring accusations against Harris’s husband.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Giving the mic ole Hawk Tuah': Donald Trump's gesture during Wisconsin rally goes viral
item.description: In the final days before the election, Donald Trump and Kamala Harris held competing rallies in Wisconsin. Trump faced microphone issues leading to a viral moment due to an awkward gesture. Harris’ team posted the clip with a cryptic caption. Despite difficulties, Trump managed to keep the crowd engaged amid the technical problems.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Social media sensation 'Peanut the Squirrel' euthanized for rabies testing
item.description: Peanut the Squirrel, a pet of content creator Mark Longo, was euthanized by New York authorities for rabies testing after being seized from his home. Fans initiated a petition and fundraiser to save Peanut, but legal and health guidelines mandated euthanasia. Officials remind the public to contact licensed wildlife rehabilitators for injured or orphaned animals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
